resources.name: AFD data 2011-12-06

organization.description:
This is a group for datasets relevant for [Open Data Day](http://www.opendataday.org/). Anyone can add datasets to this group so please just hit edit and add the dataset (if the dataset is not yet on thedatahub please just  add it using the Add Dataset link at the top of the page -- you may need to log in first!).

International Open Data Hackathon Day is an annual event in which people around the world gather to write applications, liberate data, create visualisations and publish analyses using open public data to show support for and encourage the adoption of open data policies by the world's local, regional and national governments.

The [Open Knowledge Foundation] (www.okfn.org) and [CKAN] (http://ckan.org) will be running an open data hack day at the Barbican in London in support of the event. More details here: http://www.meetup.com/OpenKnowledgeFoundation/London-GB/536442/
organization.title: Open Data Day 2011
organization.name: open-data-day-2011

name: france-afd
notes:
Database of development projects funded by the French Government and financed through AFD. No exportable data.
## Details
AFD is the Groupe Agence Française de Développement, a bi-lateral development finance institution established in 1941 that works on behalf of the French government. Its mission is to finance development according to France’s Overseas Development Assistance policies.
AFD is wholly owned by the French State. It is a public entity dedicated to activities of an industrial and commercial nature, and operates under the aegis of the French Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Overseas Territories. AFD is endowed with €400 million, and manages a loan portfolio worth more than €10.44 billion as of the end of 2007.
AFD traces its origins back to 1941 when General de Gaulle, having obtained refuge in London, founded an organization that was AFD’s direct predecessor: The Central Fund of Free France (Caisse centrale de la France libre or CCFL) was establish by the law of December 2nd.
In 2007, AFD committed over €3.5 billion to more than 60 developing countries in Africa, Asia, the Mediterranean Basin, the Middle East, South America, and the French Overseas Territories. AFD uses a wide range of financial instruments to underwrite its activities: grants, subsidies, guarantees, loans, equity shareholdings, co-financing and local bank intermediation. AFD works hand-in-hand with many partners: national, regional and local governments; local authorities and municipalities; international agencies; non-governmental organizations; foundations; private companies; entrepreneurs; and local banks, microfinance institutions and capital markets.

extras.value: To access complete list of projects, navigate to projects/projects step by step. Then click on "projects database" on the right hand panel. Can also select to filter by sector or country at this stage too. There is a map view feature but I couldn't get project information from this.Most project information is in French.
No (Not all data in individual project page shown on spreadsheet layout)

Some fields incomplete in project information. Only encompasses recent project work, not an archive of all projects conducted by AFD. Not all countries listed above have project listings related to them.
AFD, 5 rue Roland Barthes, 75598 PARIS Cedex 12, FRANCEInternational phone number + 33 1 53 44 31 31International fax number + 33 1 44 87 99 39

Project label, Project number, Country of realisation, Recipient, Project status, Operating sector, AFD agency, Environmental classification, Social classification, Project execution comment, Financial information, Total cost of the project, AFD Financing, Type of funding, Co-financing?, Chronology, Date of FIP's agreement, Date of assignment, Contact, Project manager, Agency manager, Responsible structure of the recipient
AFD founded in 1941, but considering the small number of projects in the database, it must be more recent than that

"Informations presented on this website are public, except the photos and the graphical issues which should be submitted to the agreement of the author in accordance with the article L.122-4 of the Intellectual Property Code... Reproduction of pages of this website is allowed but only with notice of the sources... These pages, and all the informations, cannot be used for commercial or advertising purposes."http://www.afd.fr/jahia/Jahia/lang/en/home/pid/3190
